title: Salvador Allende
summary: Salvador Guillermo Allende Gossens (US: /ɑːˈjɛndeɪ, -di/,[1][2] UK: /æˈ-, aɪˈɛn-/,[3][4] American Spanish: [salβaˈðoɾ ɣiˈʝeɾmo aˈʝende ˈɣosens]; 26 June 1908 – 11 September 1973) was a Chilean physician and socialist politician[5][6][7] who served as the 28th president of Chile from 3 November 1970 until his overthrow and suicide on 11 September 1973. He was the first Marxist to be elected president in a liberal democracy in Latin America.[8][9]
